alert.note: Alert for East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 21 at 10:33AM CDT until March 22 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Mississippi River At Baton Rouge affecting West Baton Rouge and East Baton Rouge Parishes. Mississippi River At Red River Landing affecting Pointe Coupee, West Feliciana and East Baton Rouge Parishes. For the Lower Mississippi River...including Red River Landing, Baton Rouge, Donaldsonville, Reserve, New Orleans...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River At Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, River islands from Red River Landing downstream to Baton Rouge will be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 35.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CDT Tuesday was 35.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 24.3 feet Tuesday, April 18. - Flood stage is 35.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 35.0 feet on 05/03/1891. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued when updates are needed.

area.areaDesc: East Baton Rouge; West Baton Rouge
